abstract.para: The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is a protocol designed to access and maintain information directories. LDAP can be used for user and group management, system configuration management, address management, and more.

sect1.title: OpenLDAP is deprecated
sect1.para: OpenLDAP is deprecated and unsupported in codestream 15, except for &sle; 15 SP0 and SP1 LTSS. OpenLDAP is replaced with &ds389; in &sle; 15 SP2 and up. It is recommended to use the latest &sle; release for new &ds389; deployments.
For more information about &ds389;, see the upstream documentation, available at .
